info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Anderson County through 600 PM EDT... At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Anderson, or over Anderson Airport. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Homeland Park, Northlake, Starr, Anderson Airport, Lake Hartwell, Broadway Lake and Sadlers Creek State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
